ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest30.descrip: The &9Aether Portal Frame&r can be constructed in the same basic shape as a &9Nether portal&r.
You'll need to use &3Glowstone&r blocks as the frame, and pour a &3Bucket of Water&r to light it.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest30.title: The Aether
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest35.descrip: This one isn't as common, but you can find it inside the islands if you mine around.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest35.title: 64x Icestone
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest36.title: Blocks of the Aether
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest42.title: Slayther
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest43.descrip: The &6Slider&r will move around the room gaining speed as you do damage to it.
The only way to do any damage is to use a &3Pickaxe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest44.descrip: The &6Valkyrie Queen&r uses basic melee attacks, but hits very hard.
Anything that &aincreases your attack range&r will help make the fight easier.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest45.descrip: The &6Sun Spirit&r cannot be damaged with basic weapons.

In order to damage the boss, you will need to wait for &dIce Crystals&r to be launched, and hit them with your sword toward the &6Sun Spirt&r. This will spawn an add that you can attack with your sword.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest46.descrip: This dungeon can be located underground.
&dSentry Mobs&r will be activated as you adventure through the dungeon and will explode on you.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest46.title: The Bronze Dungeon
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest47.descrip: This dungeon can be located floating on clouds in the sky.
&dThe Valkyrie&r that inhabit this dungeon are non aggressive, but will fight back if they are attacked. You will need to &ckill regular Valkyrie&r until you get &310 Victory Medals&r.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest47.title: Silver Dungeon
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest48.descrip: This dungeon can be located by finding islands that have many &3Golden Oak trees&r.
The dungeon is only 1 room that consists of the &6Sun Spirit&r that deals heavy fire damage.
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest48.title: Gold Dungeon
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest49.descrip: Cloud Staff - Summons clouds next to you that fire ice balls at the mobs you fight
Flaming Sword - Sets mobs on fire
Hammer of Kingbdogz - Melee weapon that can shoot projectiles
Lightning Knife - Throw the knife, and lightning will hit the spot it lands.
Phoenix Bow - Sets mobs on fire
Sentry Boots - Protect you from fall damage
Shield of Repulsion - Reflects projectiles back at the attacker
Swet Cape - Lets you ride the Swet mob
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest49.title: Bronze Loot
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest50.descrip: Holy Sword - +15 damage to Undead mobs
Lightning Sword - Enemies you hit are also struck with lightning
Valkyire armor and gloves - Full set gives temporary flight
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest50.title: Silver Loot
ftbquests.chapter.aether.quest51.descrip: Phoenix armor - Swim in lava with full fire resistance. DON'T swim in water unless you want Obsidian armor
Pig Slayer - Massive damage to pig type mobs
Sun Altar - Control time in Aether

ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest13.descript: Place these in the world, click on them and set the advancement or stat you want to display.

ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest3.descripti: Nature's Compass - Locates various biomes of the world.
Explorer's Compass - Locates various structures of the world.
Honey Compass - Locates the Cell Maze where you can find the Queen Bee.
Meterorite Compass - Locates the closest meteor so that you can start Applied Energistic 2.

ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest7.descripti: Use the Ankh of Prayer at a Decorative Grave for some Knowledge of Death experience.
ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest8.descripti: The main purpose of this mod is to create a Tomb when you die that contains all of your items.
If you click 'K' by default, on your keyboard you can open the "Knowledge of Death" screen.
You can gain some easy experience by customizing your grave through this menu.
You can also create a Decorative Grave and Ankh of Prayer. Use the Ankh at the grave when the timer is available and you'll gain more Knowledge of Death experience.
ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest8.title: Tombstone
ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest9.descripti: This mod lets you upload images from the internet and use them as paintings.
ftbquests.chapter.age_1.quest9.title: Immersive Paintings

ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest40.descri: Now that you've arrived in Alfheim, you can do some dragon hunting!
You'll need to slay at least 1 Fire/Ice/Lightning dragon in order to get the Dragon Eye.
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest40.title: Alfheim
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest41.descri: If you're using the &3Lexica Botanica&r to put the hologram of the platform in your world; it says that you need to use &3Iron Blocks&r, but you don't really have to.

What you do need, is a &3Beacon&r in the middle, blocks that surround the &3Beacon&r, and &31 Gaia Pylon&r on each corner of the platform, these should be placed 3 blocks out diagonally, and 3 blocks up.
You will need to place &31 Terrasteel Ingot&r on the &3Beacon&r to begin the &6Gaia of Guardian&r boss battle.
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest41.title: The Arena
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest48.title: Necessary Items
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest51.descri: Getting to Alfheim will be tough as you'll need to challenge the &6Gaia Guardian II&r in order to get the &3Rune of Fimbultyr&r.

You will need to craft a &3Branch of Yggdrasil&r, and a &3Horn of the Wild&r. Place the horn on the branch, and fill it with mana. Once full, you can drink from the horn. Now, when you face the &6Gaia Guardian II&r you should get a &3Rune of Fimbultyr&r.
You'll need to do a &9Rune Ritual&r in order to get the &3Blood of Kvasir&r.
Once you have the blood, you can craft it together with &3Honey&r to make the &3Mead of Kvasir&r.
Drink the mead, and now you can step through your &9Alfheim portal&r.
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest51.title: Getting to Alfheim
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.quest56.title: Dragon Eye
ftbquests.chapter.alfheim.title: Alfheim
For this section we're only going to some storage basics of AE2.
If you want to learn more advanced AE2 you can read their &bofficial source&r at &ahttps://appliedenergistics.org&r,
Check out &bChosen Architect's Guide to Applied Energistics 2&r: &ahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ay0Js2TkI1E&r
Your main hub will consist of the &9Controller&r, and at least a basic &3ME Terminal&r.
A basic Auto Crafting setup would involve a few &3Crafting Storage&r, a &3Co-Processing Unit&r, &3Molecular Assemblers&r, and some &3ME Pattern Providers&r.
The video in the previous quest is a great guide on helping you build one if you aren't sure how.
The &9Inscriber Presses&r can be found in &9Sky Stone Meteors&r in the Overworld.
These will be put inside your &9Inscribers&r to allow you to create &3Printed Silicon&r and various circuits.
The ME Storage Cells from AE2 Things are able to store items without an item limit.
Lets you access your Network from far away, and eventually across dimensions!
Each &3Wireless Card&r added increses the power usage.
Basic Upgrade Cards for the Applied Energistics 2 network.
Advanced Upgrade Cards for the Applied Energistics 2 network.
The ME Requester lets you keep specific items in stock from your network.
The first machines you will build for Applied Energistics 2 begins here.
To get some &3Fluix&r you'll need to throw &3Redstone&r, &3Nether Quartz&r, and &3Charged Certus Quartz&r in some water.

ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest56.des: 1) Will begin regenerating rapidly that last a few seconds. Hitting him will interrupt this.
2) Turns the water fountains into lava fountains.
The &6Alchemist&r will cycle between 4 different attacks.
1) Spawn Lingering Poison in the 4 corners of the room.
2) Will launch 3 arrows in different directions.
4) Summons a line of 0 to 11 spikes in the direction of a player.
Starts when The &6Alchemist&r gets to 50% health.
He will gain an additional 2 attacks:
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest61.des: Progressing beyond this point is not required for the eye.
The Poison dungeon is located in a strangely shaped tree. Inside of it you will find a spider lair.
The dungeon consists of 4 floors, with each floor containing a dungeon key. You will use these keys on the Poison Keystone to start the boss battle.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest62.des: This is a large spider that can crawl up on the ceiling. The spider will charge at you, and can be stunned if you use a shield to intercept the charge.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest76.des: The &6Summoner&r will teleport around the room while shooting spheres, and summoning adds.
The &6Summoner&r will now he will begin to regenerate, summon lightning, and continue to summon adds.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest77.des: Progressing beyond this point is not required for the eye.
The structure is a massive green building that's very easy to see when it's close.
The dungeon consists of 4 floors, with each floor containing a dungeon key. You will use these keys on the Nature Keystone to start the boss battle.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest78.des: This boss summons walls that will shield him from any attacks. When the walls are up the boss will summon various adds and roots.
The walls will need to be attacked with an axe.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.quest80.des: To enter them, you'll need to find a &dGatekeeper&r in the &2Overworld&r, trade him some &3Emeralds&r for a &3Zeal Lighter&r, and find the &9Gatekeeper's portal frame&r which should be close by. &aLight the frame like you would a Nether portal with the lighter&r.
&l&c&nTools and Weapons from the Overworld do not work properly in either dimension.&r&r&r
You'll want to craft yourself a new set of &6Blue Skies&r specific gear when you enter.
&aArmor still works, so if you have stronger armor you may have some extra protection&r.
The main goal of the pack will be to defeat the &dSummoner&r and &dAlchemist&r, with the other two bosses being optional with &asome modified rewards&r.
ftbquests.chapter.blue_skies.title: Blue Skies
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest12.des: The main goal of the &6Bumblezone&r is to find the &dQueen Bee&r.
Once you talk to her, you will unlock access to the &bHoney Eye&r.
To enter the zone you'll need to throw an &bEnder Pearl&r at a &9Beehive/Nest&r, or push yourself in with a &9Piston&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest14.sub: Use a Piston to push yourself into the hive.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest15.sub: Use an Ender Pearl to teleport inside the hive.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest16.sub: Dig all the way up or down, and out - then take a leap of faith to exit the Bumblezone.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest22.des: &6Productive Bees&r offers a &aBee Queen questline&r. To follow that, you can look at the &aAdvancements tab&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest23.des: This compass will lead you to a &dCell Maze&r structure within &6The Bumblezone&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest24.des: Search inside the &9Honey Cocoons&r for a chance to find another &bHoney Compass&r that will lead you to the &dQueen's Throne Room&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.quest26.des: If you feed a bee, or &9Brood Block&r you have a chance at getting the &dProtection of the Hive&r effect.
&aThis will make bees defend you against other attackers&r.
ftbquests.chapter.bumblezone.title: Bumblezone
ftbquests.chapter.creative.quest26.descr: From here on out you'll need to devise your own setups for any resource automation you may need.
Best of luck finishing out the pack!

ftbquests.chapter.dimensional_dungeons.q: The basic frame consists of &39 Stone Bricks&r, &92 Gilded Portal Blocks&r, and &91 Portal Keystone&r.
You will need to add &92 Portal Crowns&r, and either &3White or Purple Banners&r over the &9Gilded Portal Blocks&r in order to activate &dTier 2 Dungeons&r with the &3Advanced Portal Key&r.
Ok
The Frame
All Keys must be activated by putting them in an Inscribing Station, or End Portal Frame block.
&3Portal Key&r: This is the basic key of this mod. Place it into a &3Portal Keystone&r to visit a dungeon.

&3Advanced Blank Portal Key&r: This requires &92 Portal Crowns&r placed next to the &9Portal Keystone&r, and a &3white or purple banner&r draped over the &9Portal Blocks&r, and will allow you to visit &dTier 2 dungeons&r.
&3Personal Dimension Key&r: Brings you to a very flat, and empty personal dimension where you can build.
&3Teleporter Key&r: Brings you to a &9Teleporter Hub&r with 7 keys. All keys link back to the hub. This could help you setup a fast travel network through various dimensions.
Ok
The Keys
You will need to put a key into the &9Key Inscribing Station&r, or an &9End Portal Frame&r in order to activate it.
The &9Inscribing Station&r will break after a few keys have been made, while the &9End Portal Frame&r has infinite durability.
Ok
Key Inscribing
&3Bell of Secrets&r: Works in a &6Dimensional Dungeon&r. If there is loot in the room you are standing in, this bell will ring 8 times when clicked.
&3Homeward Pearl&r: Brings you back to the start of the dungeon.
Ok
Useful Things
Dimensional Eye
Ok
Dimensional Eye Recovery
These have a rare chance to drop inside of the dungeons.
&6Dimensional Dungeons&r offers a fun way to run some dungeons filled with various mobs, traps, and treasure.
Ok
Dimensional Dungeons

ftbquests.chapter.end.quest2.subtitle: Defeat the Ender Dragon
ftbquests.chapter.end.quest3.description: The Chaos Dragon arena can be found every 10,000 blocks.
Once located, you may want to set up a safe place to place down a Waystone, or teleporter incase you die.

The basic strategy for this fight is to destroy the 14 crystals surrounding the arena, similar to that of the End dragon. To do any damage you will need Draconic Tools / Weapons loaded with modules, and a way to fly, if possible.
If you can draw the dragons attacks toward you, it's attacks will help destroy the crystals.
Once all of the crystals are destroyed you can start to attack the Chaos Dragon.
Good luck, and cross your fingers that you have enough OP flowing through your equipment to survive!
ftbquests.chapter.end.quest3.title: The Chaos Dragon

ftbquests.chapter.end.quest5.subtitle: Eye of Void

ftbquests.chapter.end.quest6.description: Preperation for the next two also requires enchanted Netherite gear or better.
ftbquests.chapter.end.quest7.description: The Ender Golem is considered a mini boss.
This guy will hit you with 3 different melee attacks.
ftbquests.chapter.end.quest7.subtitle: Defeat the Ender Golem

ftbquests.chapter.end_eyes.quest14.descr: Can be obtained by throwing a Demon's Dream Fruit into the Spirit Fire.
ftbquests.chapter.end_eyes.quest15.descr: Can be obtained after entering the Alfheim portal.

ftbquests.chapter.end_eyes.quest5.descri: Can be obtained by completing the Blocks of the Nether, and the Mobs of the Nether quest lines.
ftbquests.chapter.end_eyes.quest6.descri: Can be obtained by having a meeting with a Queen Bee in The Bumblezone.
ftbquests.chapter.end_eyes.quest8.descri: Can be obtained by attaining &34 Godforged Pearls&r, an &3Orb of the Summoner&r, and &34 Insanium Gemstones&r, and crafting it all together on a &9Crafting Table&r.

ftbquests.chapter.ender_storage.quest4.d: Ender Storage allows you to share a storage between dimensions.
After crafting a &3Ender Pouch&r, &3Ender Chest&r, or &3Ender Tank&r - you can color code it with dye.
If you create a &3Ender Tank&r and paint it with &33 Red Dyes&r any other &3Ender Tank&r that shares the same color pattern will be able to access the source tank.

ftbquests.chapter.functional_storage.que: &6Functional Storage&r allows you to create &3Storage Drawers&r that contain one, or a few (depending on the drawer) items. With upgrades these drawers can hold a massive quantity of items.
Be sure to make a &3Linking Tool&r which will allow you to link drawers to a &9Storage Controller&r.
The &3Configuration Tool&r has a few functions, but you'll mostly use it for locking your drawers.
ftbquests.chapter.good_luck.quest3.descr: Even if you get lucky and find this one, you won't really be able to wield it until you find a &3Ring of Thor&r.
The &3Ring of Thor&r comes from the &3Dice of Fate&r, which you can find in &3chests&r with a &cvery low % chance&r, or by farming the &dGaia Spirit&r.
ftbquests.chapter.good_luck.quest6.descr: Some of these items have &aalternative ways of obtaining&r them later on, such as &dcrafting&r or &ddefeating bosses&r. However, &afrom the very start&r you can &afind any of these items&r inside of most &3Chests&r, and &3Barrels&r that you discover in your adventures.
These are entirely RNG and have a &cvery low chance to drop&r. &aIf you find any of these items you got very lucky&r!

ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest10.title: 10 Slot Books
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest11.title: 12 Slot Books
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest12.descript: There are 9 different types of Magic: &cBlood,&r &5Ender&r, &6Evocation&r, &4Fire&r, Holy, &bIce&r, &eLightning&r, &2Nature&r, and &dEldritch&r.
You start by finding &3Scrolls&r in the world through looting various chests, or killing certain mobs.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest12.title: Iron's Spells and Spellbooks
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest13.descript: &aEterna&r: This value dictates how powerful the enchantments produced will be.
&6Quanta&r: Causes good and bad RNG when determining the enchant pool. Pairs with the next stat.
&eRectification&r: The higher this is the better it will counter your &6Quanta&r's bad RNG. This means a better chance your enchants won't be bad.
&dArcana&r: This stat will assist you in seeing less common enchants, and more rare enchants. It also lets you enchant more per item.

&o&cThe quests beyond this will assist in getting your Apotheosis Enchanting setup. The way I am showing is just one of many ways to attain max level enchanting, and is by no means the most efficient.&r&r
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest15.descript: To attain up to Level 30 Enchanting just surround your &9Enchanting Table&r with &915 Bookshelves&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest15.subtitle: Level 30
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest15.title: Bookshelves
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest17.descript: You can make the &9Beeshelf&r whenever you want. It will add 100% Quanta. You may want to wait to add it until you get some Rectification.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest2.subtitle: Early Game
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest20.title: Alternate Max Setup
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest21.descript: To reach level 45 you just need to add 6 &9Bookshelves&r. They can be any mix of Hell or Sea.
If you don't have a &9Beeshelf&r in, you will want to add &32 Mob Skulls&r for some &6Quanta,&r and you'll need about 4 &3Candles&r for &dArcana.&r
With this setup, you should be able to get an &9Infused Seashelf&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest21.subtitle: Level 45
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest21.title: Seashelf
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest22.descript: To reach level 45 you just need to add 6 &9Bookshelves&r. They can be any mix of Hell or Sea.
If you don't have a &9Beeshelf&r in, you will want to add &32 Mob Skulls&r for some &6Quanta,&r and you'll need about 4 &3Candles&r for &dArcana.&r
With this setup, you should be able to get an &9Infused Hellshelf&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest22.subtitle: Level 45
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest22.title: Hellshelf
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest23.title: Infused Seashelf
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest25.descript: Adding &3Skeleton&r, &3Wither Skeleton&r, &3Creeper&r, or &3Zombie Heads&r can help increase your &6Quanta&r by 5%.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest25.title: A Little Boost
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest26.descript: The &9Enchantment Library&r lets you store &3Enchantments&r inside.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest3.title: Different Inks
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest30.descript: Remove &97 Bookshelves&r and add any mix of &9Glowing Hellshelf&r or &9Crystalline Seashelf&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest30.subtitle: Level 60
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest31.descript: Now you'll want to remove another &93 Bookshelves&r and add &93 Dormant Deepshelves.&r This will let you create a &9Deepshelf&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest31.subtitle: Level 70
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest33.descript: Just add &92 Deepshelf&r into your setup for this step and craft your &9Echoing Deepshelf&r.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest33.subtitle: Level 75
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest34.descript: We just need &91 Echoing Sculkshelf&r. You'll need to kill the &6Warden&r in order to get the &3Warden Tendril&r. Use &3Shears&r on &3Sculk&r to get the &3Sculk&r item.
ftbquests.chapter.magic.quest34.subtitle: Level 80

ftbquests.chapter.magic_2.quest14.descri: You may want to build this far away from your base.
It's designed to keep growing, and growing, into a fleshy blob tower of disgustingness.
ftbquests.chapter.magic_2.quest21.descri: The goal for Biomancy is to produce &3Bio-Alchemical Fertilizer&r, and &3Organic Compound&r.
Start by crafting a &3Flesh Plunderer&r which will allow you to farm &3Living Flesh&r from Flesh Blobs that spawn from the &9Primordial Cradle&r.

The &9Primordial Cradle&r will be the first machine you construct, and it's advised to place it far away from your base, or in another dimension. This is because the cradle will keep growing if left unattended, creating a massive tower of fleshy nastyness.

Inside the cradle you will need to fill it up with &3raw meat&r, then use a few &3Golden Apples&r on the machine. Use your plunderer on the entity that spawns and hopefully you get some &3Living Flesh&r. To make the next 4 machines you'll need at least 4 &3Living Flesh&r.
&9Decomposer&r - This will allow you to break down a variety of items into their base elements.
&9Bio Forge&r - This will allow you to create the &9Digester,&r and &9Bio Lab&r. It will also let you craft some various blocks from the mod.
&9Digester&r - Feeding the &9Digester&r various food items will give you &3Nutrient&r, which is a fuel used for the &9Bio Lab&r.
&9Bio Lab&r - This will let you create a variety of different potion effects, as well as the &3Organic Compound&r you'll need for making Mystical Agriculture seeds.
ftbquests.chapter.magic_2.quest21.title: Get Fleshy
ftbquests.chapter.magic_2.quest23.descri: To be able to make Mystical Agriculture seeds you will first need &98 Infusion Pedestals&r and &91 Infusion Altar&r.
For resources, you'll need a &3Prosperity Seed&r as the base seed.
For mobs, you'll need a &3Soulium Seed&r as the base seed.
You'll also need a few tiered essence, some of the resource (or &3Soul Jar&r), and an &3Organic Compound&r.

ftbquests.chapter.magic_2.quest6.descrip: With all of the pieces of the Alfheim Portal in place, you should get to building it.

The portal should be constructed of &33 Glimmering Livingwood&r  &38 Livingwood&r, and the &9Elven Gateway Core&r. Within an 11x11x11 range of that, you will need to put two &9Mana Pools&r down, and place &3Natura Pylons&r on top of them.

Once the &9Mana Pools&r are filled up, you should be able to right click the &9Elven Gateway Core with a &3Wand of the Forest&r, and that should activate the portal, and let you begin trading with Alfheim.
If you need more assistance on this check out: &n&bhttps://botaniamod.net/lexicon.html&r&r

ftbquests.chapter.main_progression.quest: To start &6Age 1&r you will need to click through all of the Read Me quests.

The &bHealing Flask&r that you receive as a reward for this quest will let you heal up to &c3 times before it needs a recharge&r. You can &arecharge it at any Campfire&r, and it is not recoverable, &lso don't lose it!&r Later you will be able to make better flasks that hold more charges.
&a&oHere is a clickable link for where you should start next&r: &r
When the &bPlastim&r toxins hit, it mutated many people, and animals giving them extremely long lifespans, but left to roam the world mindlessly, becoming increasingly aggressive.
There hasn't been many adventurers, so many of these hostile monsters roam the planet today.
To start &6Age 2&r you will need to craft a &bPrecision Mechanism&r.
To start &6Age 3&r you will need to craft 1 of each type of &bMachine Frame&r.
To start &6Age 4&r you will need to craft a &bFinished PCB&r.
To start &6Age 5&r you will need to craft an &dAntimatter Pellet&r.
The story ties Plastek and Plastek 2 together.
It's been about 50,000 years since the discovery of &bPlastim&r. A material thought to be a super plastic, &cturned out to be disasterous&r for the entire world, for centuries to follow.

When the unstable elements &bSharkinite&r and &bWeekonium&r were discovered, combining various plastics together created &bPlastim&r. It was strong, durable, seemingly eco-friendly, but it wasn't. It was a ticking time bomb, and when the world finally met it's timer, disaster struck everywhere. &bPlastim&r was part of everything from your basic utensils, bags, bottles, to advanced cybertronik artificial limb replacements, and to the core of most peoples homes.

&bPlastim&r released a toxin worse than a &6Mekanism&r &9Fission Reactor&r&c going nuclear in your base&r.  This toxin destroyed the crops, people, wildlife, weirdly, the &4Piglin&r seemed resistant to it, though.

Remnants of &bPlastim&r can be found throughout the ocean and beaches today. While the &amaterial itself is no longer harmful to us&r, &cthe land it's embedded into is cursed&r and hurts if you touch it. Once the &bPlastim&r has been removed with a &bPlastic Picker&r, the land quickly returns to normal and the &bPlastim&r is harmless.
&9The Market People&r take &bPlastim Scrap&r as their preferred currency.

To obtain the scrap from &bPlastim Bottles&r and &bPlastim Bags&r, you'll need to find a way to crush them up so you can get that sweet, non toxic, &bPlastim Scrap&r and buy stuff from a &9Market&r person.
You only need to complete this if you lost your Eccentric Tome.
Plastim wreaked havoc across many planets and dimensions, as well. This resulted in the creation, or discovery of new dimensions.

&6The Bumblezone&r - The &9Council of Bee Queens&r made it clear that no &bPlastim&r was to be allowed within the walls of the great hive. However, as a result of this, people thought a war would be coming soon and quickly banded together to steel all of the hives &bGold&r. Now &bGold&r can be scattered throughout the &3Overworld&r. The bees really didn't care.

&aTwilight Forest&r - &bPlastim&r completely decimated the &aTwilight Forest&r, turning it into a desolate wasteland of pure nothingness. The portal is now blocked by over 6 million &bPlastim&r blocks, after the &9Great Tower of Tim&r collapsed at the portal entrance. &dShaun&r, a powerful wizard attempted to cast a spell into the portal to be able to re-enter at a later point, but instead of creating a safe barrier at the entrance, he caused a rift in the Overworld opening various portals to the &bEverbright&r, and &3Everdawn&r, and ultimately leading to the discovery of &bThe Aether&r.

&0The Otherside&r - &bPlastim&r proved to be completely disasterous to the inhabitants of the &0Otherside&r. Even before the toxins released, &bPlastim&r was known to instantly kill any creature that came within 5 feet of it. With the monster population down, many people attempted to live here. This lead to massive structures being built underground. Due to the nature of &0The Otherside&r, once the toxins released, they never dissipated leaving the entire dimension unexplorable, even with the strongest protective gear, and resistances.

&bAlfheim&r - Like the &6Bumblezone&r the inhabitants of &bAlfheim&r refused to allow &bPlastim&r into their lands. As the planets were being destroyed, it was discovered that dragons had the ability to teleport home, which happened to be &bAlfheim&r. Now &bAlfheim&r is the only place populated with dragons.

&eAd Astra Planets&r - It eventually got to a point where many of the planets were fully stripped of their resources during the great Shark Week. It was a full week dedicated to dismantling every planet block by block searching for any remnants of &bSharkinite&r, and &bWeekonium&r. Even if the technology to build a rocket was still around today, you would find nothing up there but vast emptiness.

ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest1.descript: In order to make a &9Nether Portal&r you will need &3Infused Nether Stone&r.
Just toss some &3Livingrock&r into a &9Spirit Fire&r to get &3Otherstone&r, then take the &3Otherstone&r, and throw it into the &9Spirit Fire&r to get &3Nether Stone&r.
Craft a block together with &34 Jelly Babies&r to make &3Infused Nether Stone.&r
The portal shape should be the size of any normal &9Nether Portal&r.

ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest20.title: Find a Burning Arena
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest21.descrip: Like the other fights, enchanted Netherite or better is suggested.
You may only kill 2 Ignited Revenant's per Burning Arena.
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest22.descrip: Enchanted Netherite or better gear is suggested for this fight. Fire Resistance will also greatly assist in making the fight easier.
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest23.descrip: If you aren't within melee range the boss may launch a projectile at you. Once the projectile lands, it will summon a pool of lava. You can place some Netherrack down to stop the spread of lava.'
If you're in melee range, the boss will use a melee attack and slam the ground, dealing damage and knocking you up, then you'll take additional fall damage.
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest24.descrip: You will want to bring a Sword or Axe to battle this boss.

The boss will charge at you while spinning it's shields. This will cause damage and knock y ou back. The boss also has a breath attack that will blind you and cause damage, as well as summoning a bone storm at you.
With this boss defeated, you can challenge Ignis.
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest25.descrip: Ignis is considered one of the most challenging bosses in the Cataclysm mod.
This boss will take you through 3 phases.
If the boss hits you, it will return a decent portion of it's healthbar and apply a debuff that reduces your armor.

During the 3 phases, Ignis will launch Fireballs at you which is fairly easy to dodge, it will also jab at you with a jousting attack, and there will be multiple shockwave attacks that can pull you in.
During Phase 3 Ignis will increase the frequency of his attacks, as well as drop his shield; leaving him exposed to ranged attacks.

If you have the Void Core from the Ruined Citadel, you can make easier work of Ignis by keeping your distance from him. Pair this with the Wither Shoulder Assault Weapon, you can do a pretty decent amount of damnage to Ignis all from range.
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest26.title: Nether Rewards
ftbquests.chapter.nether.quest6.title: Blocks of the Nether
ftbquests.chapter.nether.title: Nether
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest3.descr: IDAS Has some cool structures that contain blocks from Create, Quark, and Supplementaries.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest3.title: Integrated Dungeon's and Structures
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest30.desc: When Dungeons Arise has many dungeon like structures throughout the world.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest68.desc: This is the majority of new structures you can find in the overworld.
This is not all of the structures. You may run into various other surprises and useful structures as well.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest69.desc: Cataclysm offers a variety of optional boss challenges for you to take on in the Overworld, Nether, and End.
Each boss has been updated with customized loot tables.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest70.desc: Preparing for this boss will require you to have some fully enchanted Netherite gear or better, as well as a Brush.
Once inside the Cursed Pyramid you will find Suspicious Sand. Take your Brush and begin brushing. You're looking for a Necklace of the Desert which will start the Ancient Remnant fight.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest71.desc: Preperation for this boss is about the same as the others. You should be wearing enchanted Netherite gear or better, some Fire Resistances aren't a bad idea, either.
You will need a Nether Star to activate this boss.
An Infernal Forge makes a great weapon for this boss, can be obtained by defeating the Netherite Monstrosity.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest72.desc: To prepare for this fight you should have 2 Tridents. One should be enchanted with Riptide. This will let you dash across the water to dodge certain attacaks, as well as keep up with the Leviathan to keep it in range.
The other Trident should have Loyalty, and any damaging properties you want, like Impaling. Loyalty will cause the Trident to return to you when thrown.

The fight itself takes place underwater so if you'll need to find a way to breathe. If you don't have a Curios item, you can make potions. Since the water is cloudy, you may also want to use Night Vision if you have it available.

Some general protection you can get is Blessed Amethyst Crab Meat. You can find these crabs in Lush Cave Biomes. The buff lasts for about a minute and a half, so make sure to take enough for the fight. You'll need to bring the Crab meat to an Altar of Amethyst which can be located inside the Sunken City.
Now that you're prepared to fight the Leviathan, you'll need to summon it by crafting an Abyssal Sacrifice.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest76.desc: The Leviathan has 2 phases, with the second phase starting at 50%.
It will cycle between several different attacks like lasers, mines, pulling you in with it's tongue, a bite attack, and a purple vortex that will vaccuum you up and cause damage.
If you get speared with the tongue attack and pulled close to the boss, you can quickly try to melee the boss for bonus damage, if you can survive.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest77.desc: The Ancient Remnant has several attacks to look out for. It will charge at you, throw tornados at you, bite you, tail whip and smash, shockwave, and send sand falling down on you.
Continue dodging attacks and work on the boss with a sword, or other melee type weapon as your bow will do nothing.
ftbquests.chapter.overworld.quest78.desc: This boss has 2 phases with the second phase starting at 50%, and will cycle between Missile, Rocket, and Laser modes.
If the attacks hit you, it may apply a Withering aeffect so be prepared.

Every so often the boss will charge up and shoot a larger Laser attack at you called the Death Laser. If you can bait the Death Laser attack into an EMP block in the boss room, you can trigger an EMP which will disable the boss for a few moments.
At 50% the boss will become shielded making it immune to arrow attacks, and giving it Regeneration.

ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest1.descrip: Thank you for checking out &6Plastek 2&r!  I hope you enjoy the pack.
If you have any questions, or would like to provide any feedback / bugs, feel free to join the Discord:

The quests in this pack are &adesigned to give you a working product via automation&r, you just &cneed to construct your own pipe, belt, or other ways of moving items and fluids&r. These &aquests are very basic setups, and you should definitely construct something bigger and better&r to make progression easier.
It's up to you and your creativity to make better automations!
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest1.title: Welcome!
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest10.subtit: This shape is used as the shape to represent all other shapes.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest10.title: Quest Shapes
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest11.descri: It is intended to have to complete all or most of this quest shape.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest11.title: Main Quest
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest12.descri: A Major Advancement could be a progression in materials, technology, or location.
These quests should contain a &bBag of Tears&r, and sometimes a &dBag of Hopes and Dreams&r.
The &dBag of Hopes and Dreams&r is the same as the &bBag of Tears&r, except a few of the better items have a slightly higher success rate.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest12.title: Major Advancement
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest13.descri: Quests that may support your adventure, but shouldn't be necessary.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest13.title: Side Quest
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest14.descri: This shape represents a quest to recover certain special items if lost.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest14.title: Reclaimable Item
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest15.descri: Most crops and trees have a season associated with them. &cIf the crop is not in season&r, it will &l&cnot&r&r grow. You can counter this by using &aGreenhouse Glass&r (&oany Green Stained Glass&r)
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest15.title: Crops
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest16.descri: That might happen a lot, especially early on. The mobs are pretty vicious.
Don't worry though. If you die, a &aTombstone will be created that contains all of your items where you perished&r. Just use the key on it, and you will get everything back.
&aSometimes you might even be granted a special key that will let you teleport back&r. You can also craft this key by combining your Grave Key and an Ender Pearl in a crafting window.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest16.title: Death
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest17.descri: Don't forget to set a home with &a/sethome <name>&r no brackets. &aIf you dont put a name you can just use /home&r, otherwise you'll need to &a/home <name>&r. This command has a 5 minute cooldown.
If you're playing on a server, you can use the &a/tpa <name>&r command to teleport to a friend. This TP must be approved by the person  you are trying to TP to.
&aF7&r will enable Light Overlays which will show potential for monster spawns.
&aF9&r will cycle between various chunk view modes, being able to view the chunk grid, or the region grid.
Each Age will unlock an additional quantity of home points.
You can use the &a/back&r command to go back through your various teleports (5 minute cooldown)
The &a/rtp&r command randomly teleports you somewhere within 25,000 blocks (10 minute cooldown)
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest17.title: Fancy Features
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest18.descri: Don't forget to create or join an FTB Teams.
This will unlock features like Land Claim and Chunk Loading.
Each age you will unlock additional claims and force loading.
You can also see various leaderboard stats by typing &b/leaderboards&r and tabbing through the various statistics.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest18.title: FTB Teams
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest19.descri: You will need to complete various tasks in each dimension to unlock a few of the End Remastered Eyes which will be used on the End Portal Frame to get to The End.
&3Infused Eye&r - Created in a Draconic tiered Infusion Crafter.
&3Thermal Paste Eye&r - Make your first Finished PCB
&3Plastic Eye&r - Make your first Plastic Sheet
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest19.title: The End
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest2.descrip: Yup, that's right. You're starting with &clower health&r, and &cless HP regen&r than normal. Don't worry though, &6Farmer's Delight&r and &6Pam's Harvestcraft&r are both in the pack along with &6Spice of Life: Carrot&r.
That means there will be many different foods you can eat. &aThe more unique foods that you eat, the more your HP will increase&r.
This pack has a total of &a1,536 different foods&r you can make. To account for uncraftable items, you will gain &a1 Heart&r for each milestone &aup to 1,400 foods&r.
You might find additional HP boosts through the mods listed in the "Power" quest.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest2.title: Health
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest20.descri: &6Better Combat&r improves on combat as a whole.
You'll find that &aattacks now have combos you can use by executing multiple swings in a row&r. You can also now &ahold down your attack button to keep on attacking&r.
Got yourself &atwo one handed weapons&r? Try &aDual Wielding&r. With &aone weapon on your hotbar, and one weapon in your offhand&r, you can wield two different weapons. Go forth, Spartacus!
If you &apress R you can do a combat roll&r in the direction you are facing. This has a &ccooldown of 4 seconds between each roll&r, and &cconsumes about 1 food per roll&r.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest20.title: Combat
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest21.descri: Sometimes the chain won't be necessary and you can skip ahead, or do your own thing.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest21.title: Quest Initiator
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest3.descrip: Your character can attain additional power through &6Artifacts&r, &6Inventory Pets&r, &6Relics&r, &6Nameless Trinkets&r, &6Tarot Cards&r, and &6Everlasting Abilities&r.
You can find all of these throughout the world.
For &6Everlasting Abilities&r the equip cost has been inflated significantly, and you are only allowed to equip 4 total abilities.

&6Passive Skill Tree&r is also added to this pack. However, t&ahe only way to obtain skill points is by crafting them&r. &cYou won't be able to craft them until Age 2&r. &aTo access the skill tree press O&r.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest3.title: Power
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest4.descrip: Playing on a server or with friends? No problem! The &adifficulty scaling works on a per player, per age scaling system within a large radius&r. If you are light years ahead of your friends who are just starting, and you are in their general vicinity, &athe monsters will balance out to somewhere in between your levels&r.
A &dZombie&r in &bAge 3&r has 38 HP and caps around 44 HP
A &dZombie&r in &bAge 4&r has 52 HP and caps around 100 HP
A &dZombie&r in &bAge 5&r has 100 HP and &cgains additional armor&r with each increase of the &cdifficulty cap; which goes up to 250&r.

Many mobs will spawn with armor on, and have various abilities normal &6Minecraft&r mobs do not. Some mobs might &crifle through your chests and throw items on the ground&r, some may &cthrow Ender Pearls&r, some may &cbreak blocks&r, &cclimb ladders&r, and more.

Upon entering each new age the &cmonster difficulty will increase&r, and continue to rise at a rate of 0.15 per Minecraft day&c; the difficulty will increase until it reaches the cap for the respective Age.
A &dZombie&r in &bAge 2&r has 31 HP and caps around 36 HP
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest4.title: Mobs
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest5.descrip: Progression is gated behind various quests, and &6Totally Harmonius Item Stages&r. &aAs you make your way through the pack you will unlock new mods and mod features&r.
&aStorage is not gated&r, so you could in theory build an &6AE2&r system in Age 1, but you wouldn't have any real way of powering it until Age 2.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest5.title: Progression
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest6.descrip: The &avarious Resource Generators&r in this pack are &6Mob Grinding Utils&r, &6Hostile Neural Networks&r, &6Resource Chickens&r, &6Productive Bees&r, and &6Mystical Agriculture&r.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest6.title: Resource Generation
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest7.descrip: This adventure will take you through &6The Bumblezone&r, &9Blue Skies&r, &cThe Nether&r, &bThe Aether&r, &eDimensional Dungeons&r, &aAlfheim&r, and &dThe End&r!

If you want the mods appropriate difficulty setting it's better to do &9Blue Skies&r and &bThe Aether&r sooner rather than later, but you are able to do them whenever you're ready to go to &dThe End&r.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest7.title: Dimensions
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest8.descrip: Super Side Quests offers a few different completely optional (&o&abut sometimes useful&r&r) quest lines for you to enjoy and complete.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest8.title: Optional Quests
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest9.subtitl: This shape is only used in the Main Progression Quest Journal tab.
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.quest9.title: Main Progression
ftbquests.chapter.read_me.title: Read Me!
ftbquests.chapter.relics.title: Relics
ftbquests.chapter.saplings.title: Saplings
ftbquests.chapter.seeds.title: Seeds
ftbquests.chapter.simple_storage.quest13: For this pack, Simple Storage has been slightly nerfed. You won't find many of the fancy remotes it has. Instead, there is only a basic remote that allows you to access your main storage from anywhere.
You'll need to craft a Storage Network Root and a Storage Request Table.  Connect them together, then connect a Basic Cable to your Storage Network Root.
Lead the cable to your storage where you will need to connect a Link Cable to the storage to make it part of your storage network.

An example: Connect a Link Cable to your Storage Controller, connect it together with a Basic Cable to your Storage Network Root, and all drawers connected to that controller should become part of the network.
ftbquests.chapter.simple_storage.title: Simple Storage
ftbquests.chapter.statues.title: Statues
ftbquests.chapter.tarot_cards.quest1.sub: Store all of your cards inside a Tarot Deck!
ftbquests.chapter.tarot_cards.title: Tarot Cards
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest1.title: Sequenced Assembly: Precision Mechanism
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest15.descrip: For now, the only way to make a Brass Ingot will be to put your Copper and Zinc in a Heated Mixer.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest18.descrip: You can use the Animal Capture Net to place a chicken in the Chicken Stasis Chamber.
You will need to add seeds to the Stasis Chamber in order for a chicken to produce anything.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest20.descrip: If you capture a chicken with an &3Animal Capture Net&r and feed it &35 Copper Blocks&r you can Automate &3Copper Ingots.&r

By default the chicken &4won't output quickly&r, or plentifully. If you &2breed chickens together&r though, the &2baby will inherit it's parent stat plus more&r. Your chickens stats can increase to &2Growth 10, Gain 10, and Strength 10&r.
There are many different Resource Chickens available so check JEI to see what you need.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest20.title: Making Copper
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest22.descrip: From here you will need to do a little bit of the Magic tree to get a Spiritfire started.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest23.title: Zinc Dust
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest30.descrip: Put your Iron Ingots and Andesite in here to make Andesite Alloy
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest40.descrip: Using an &9Encased Fan&r and some &3Water&r you can create a &9Washing&r setup.
By washing &3Dirt,&r you can get some &3Gold Nuggets&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest40.title: Making Gold
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest41.descrip: If you use Create's &9Crushing Wheels&r to crush &3Netherrack&r you can get some &3Cinder Flour&r.
Using a Create &9Spout&r and some &3Fluid XP&r you can pour it over the &3Cinder Flour&r to get &3Redstone.&r
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest41.title: Making Redstone
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest42.descrip: Putting &3Cobbled Andesite&r, &3Diorite,&r or &3Deepslate&r through a &9Millstone&r will give you &3Zinc Dust.&r
If you throw &3Zinc Dust&r into a &9Spiritfire&r you will get a &3Zinc Essence&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest42.title: Making Zinc
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest43.descrip: If you &9crush&r or &9mill&r some &3Cobblestone&r you will get &3Gravel.&r
If you take that &3Gravel&r and &9wash&r it you will get &3Flint&r and &3Iron Nuggets&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest43.title: Making Iron
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest47.descrip: You'll need to make a &3Wooden Gear&r with &34 Sticks&r, then add &34 Stone&r to the &3Wooden Gear&r to make a &3Stone Gear&r.
If you use &9Mechanical Crafting&r from Create you can make &32 Stone Gear&r instead of &31&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.quest47.title: Making Stone Gears
ftbquests.chapter.tech_1.title: Tech
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest10.descrip: For the quest we just need to make the smallest configuration of the &9Pressure Chamber&r which is 3x3x3. You can build it up to a 5x5x5 though if you need it to be bigger.
When placing the &3Pressure Chamber Interface&r in the multi-block, the yellow will be for output, and the blue for input.
In the image, the &3Pressure Chamber Valve&r is in the back hooked up to some &9Air Compressors&r.
Don't forget to put &3Security Upgrades&r in any Pneumaticcraft machine that you're able to!
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest10.title: Pressure Chamber
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest14.title: Sequenced Assembly: Sturdy Sheet
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest22.descrip: Mixing the Acid and Liquid Fertilizer together will give you Etching Acid.
You need Etching Acid for Advanced Machine Frames, as well as Printed Circuit Boards.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest23.title: Spout It All Out
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest24.title: Etching Acid
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest25.descrip: The mob farm from Age 1 should have plenty of Fluid XP.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest25.title: Fluid XP
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest26.title: Liquid Fertilizer
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest27.title: Acid
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest28.title: LPG
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest30.descrip: You should use up to &94 Refinery Outputs&r to store each fluid, and help retain heat on the machine.
Once the refinery is filled up with &3Crude Oil&r and it reaches at least 100 degrees it will refine into 4 different fluids:
The trapdoors you see in the image assist in insulating the refinery.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest30.title: You're So Refine
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest31.title: Crude Oil
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest32.descrip: If you don't want to go out, find oil and move it closer to base, you can always get yourself some Oily Bees!
Just head out to the Deep Ocean biome with your boat, fishing rod, and some bee cages. Once you've caught yourself some Oily Bees you will need to make a little home for them.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest32.title: Oily Bee
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest33.title: Centrifuge
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest34.descrip: You will need to progress in Biomancy to make any Bio-Alchemical Fertilizer.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest35.title: Fluid XP
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest36.descrip: In the example the &9Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r is on the ground and has Industrial Foregoing &3Plastic&r, a &3Dispenser Upgrade&r, and a &3Security Upgrade&r. A &3Heat Pipe&r used to transfer heat comes out of the back of the processing plant, while a &3Vortex Tube&r with the red side touching the &3Heat Pipe&r begins the heating process.
Once the plant reaches 100 degrees it will begin mixing &3Bio Diesel&r or &3LPG&r, and Industrial Foregoing &3Plastic&r to get &3Molten Plastic&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest38.title: Assembly Drill
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest39.title: Box of Supreme Machine Frame Parts
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest41.title: Empty Box
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest46.descrip: You'll need to setup a &9Sequenced Assembly&r for the &9Pity Machine Frame&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest46.title: Making a Pity Machine Frame
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest47.descrip: If you wash a &3Magma Block&r you will get &3Obsidian&r.
Send the &3Obsidian&r through some &9Crushing Wheels&r to get &3Powdered Obsidian&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest47.title: Making Powdered Obsidian
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest48.descrip: To make &3Acid&r you'll need to put &3Crude Oil&r into a Pneumaticcraft &9Refinery&r which will get you &3Diesel&r, &3Kerosene&r, &3Gasoline&r, and &3LPG&r.
Feed the &3LPG&r and some &3Fluid XP&r to a Pneumaticcraft &9Fluid Mixer&r to get &3Acid&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest48.title: Making Acid
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest49.descrip: To make &3Liquid Fertilizer&r you will need to put &3Bio-Alchemical Fertilizer&r from Biomancy and some &3Water&r in a &9Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest49.title: Making Liquid Fertilizer
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest5.title: Sequenced Assembly: Pity Machine Frame
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest50.descrip: You'll need to craft together an &3Empty Box&r, &3Advanced Machine Frame&r, &3Compressed Iron Gear&r, &3Sturdy Sheet&r, &33 Iron Sheet&r, and some &3Pressure Chamber Glass&r to get the &3Supreme Machine Frame Parts Box&r.
Place the parts box in your &9Drill Assembly&r to get a &3Supreme Machine Frame&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest50.title: Making a Box of Machine Parts
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest53.descrip: A Mob Grinder should be a great way to get some &3Bone.&r You can also make yourself a Bone Chicken for some &3Bone Meal&r.
Later you willl be able to use Hostile Neural Networks, Mystical Agriculture, and Productive Bees.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest53.title: Making Bone
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest54.descrip: You may not be able to make &3Diamond&r just yet, but you shouldn't need the supreme frames until later anyways.
You'll soon be able to use Mystical Agriculture and Productive Bees if you aren't already.
If you're swimming in coal, you can turn 8 blocks of coal into a &3Diamond&r in the &9Pressure Chamber&r as well.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.quest54.title: Making Diamond
ftbquests.chapter.tech_2.title: Tech
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest1.descript: Take 2 Capacitors, 2 Transistors, and an Unassembled PCB to create a Printed Circuit Board.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest12.descrip: Using an Assembly Laser program you can assembly an Empty PCB into an Unassembled PCB.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest12.title: Laser Assembly
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest17.descrip: 1 Emerald Dust, 1 Green Dye, 1 Plastic Sheet inside an Induction Smelter will create an Empty PCB.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest21.title: Bucket of Molten Plastic
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest23.descrip: In the example the &9Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r is on the ground and has Industrial Foregoing &3Plastic&r, a &3Dispenser Upgrade&r, and a &3Security Upgrade&r. A &3Heat Pipe&r used to transfer heat comes out of the back of the processing plant, while a &3Vortex Tube&r with the red side touching the &3Heat Pipe&r begins the heating process.
Once the plant reaches 100 degrees it will begin mixing &3Bio Diesel&r or &3LPG&r, and Industrial Foregoing &3Plastic&r to get &3Molten Plastic&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest28.title: Latex
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest29.title: Water
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest31.descrip: Be sure to double check JEI on this one. Oak isn't the only tree that you can produce Latex from. All of the Vanilla trees should work.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest32.descrip: To make a &3Capacitor&r it will be &33 Electrum Wire&r, 1&3 Plastic Sheet&r, and &31 Blue Paste&r
To make a &3Transistor&r it will be &33 Electrum Wire&r, &31 Plastic Sheet&r, and &31 Dielectric Paste&r
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest32.title: Making Capacitors and Transistors
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest33.descrip: Putting a &9Fluid Extractor&r on a &3Log&r will get you some &3Latex&r.
Put &3Latex&r, and some &3water&r into a &9Latex Processing Unit&r to get &3Dry Rubber&r
Put the &3Dry Rubber&r into a &9Redstone Furnace&r and you will get &3Plastic&r
Place the &3Plastic&r inside a &9Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r, with some &3LPG&r or &3Biodiesel&r to create &3Molten Plastic&r.
You can then use a &3Bucket&r (or a Pneumaticcraft Fluid Tank) to bucket out &3Molten Plastic&r.

With your &3Molten Plastic&r bucket in hand, place it inside a &9Barrel&r with a &9Heat Frame&r attached. As long as heat is provided to the &9Heat Frame&r, the contents inside the barrel should convert to &3Plastic Sheets&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest33.title: Making Plastic Sheets
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest38.descrip: To automate or at least semi automate &3Clay&r you can do a few different things.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest38.title: Making Clay
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest42.descrip: If you put a Blaze Rod in a Pulverizer you will get 3 Blaze Rods!
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest49.descrip: With a little help from Hostile Neural Networks we can make quick work of &3Blaze Powder&r.
You'll need to craft a &3Model Framework&r and click on a Blaze with it.
Put the &3Model Framework&r into a &9Deep Learner&r, then go out and kill some &3Blazes&r.  The more &3Blazes&r you kill, the better your &3Predictions&r will be, which means more resources.
You can check the status of your kills on the &9Deep Learner&r.
Once you're satisfied with the kills place the &3Model Framework&r inside a &9Simulation Chamber&r with some &3Prediction Matrixes&r and let the simulation run.
Once some &3Predictions&r have been successful you can collect your &3Generalized Prediction&r, or &3Blaze Predictions&r.
These &3Predictions&r can then be placed in a &9Loot Fabricator&r to get your loot.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest49.title: Making Blaze Powder
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest50.descrip: If you have leftover &3Flint&r from your &3Iron Nugget&r automation you can &9Haunt&r it (like &9Washing&r but with &9Soul Fire&r).
By &9Haunting&r &3Flint&r you can convert it into &3Coal&r.
Take the &3Coal&r, put it in a &9Pyrolyzer&r to get &3Tar&r, &3Coke&r, and &3Heavy Oil&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest50.title: Making Coke
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest51.descrip: Don't be fooled by Just Enough Resources UI.
In this pack a Blizz will not drop the Blizz Cube, instead it will drop Blizz Powder. You will need to put the powder into a Blast Chiller in order to turn it into a cube.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest54.descrip: To automate or at least semi automate &3Clay&r you can do a few different things.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest54.title: Making Clay
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest6.title: Blue Paste
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest63.title: 100% Gene Sampled Honey Treat
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest64.title: Gene Sample
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest66.title: Squashed Bee Material
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest70.title: Squish Blazing Bees
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest71.title: Magmatic Bee
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest72.title: Nomad Bee
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest73.descrip: You can get your &3Blizz&r from Mystical Agriculture if you want, or you could have some fun with Bees!
First you'll need at least 1 Nomad Bee and 1 Magmatic Bee.
Breed them together to get a Blazing Bee.
Using a &3Piston&r, smash the bee into a &9Bottler&r machine loaded with &3Glass Bottles&r. This should get you some &3Squashed Bee Material&r.
Put the &3Squashed Bee Material&r into a &9Centrifuge&r to get a &3Blazing Gene Sample&r.
You need to combine about &35 Blazing Gene Samples&r and &31 Honey Treat&r to make a &3100% Gene Sampled Honey Treat&r.
Take your 100% Gene Sampled Honey Treat and place it inside a &9BaBee Incubator&r with an &3Egg&r. This will turn into a &3Blazing Bee Spawn Egg&r.
You can now craft a &3BizBee Spawn Egg&r by surrounding the &3Blazing Bee Spawn Egg&r with &3Blizz Powder&r in the crafting window.
Now you should have the BizBee to start producing &3Blizz Powder&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest73.title: Making Blizz Powder
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest74.descrip: Making &3Rosin&r is as simple as placing an &9Arboreal Extractor&r on &3Spruce&r, &3Acacia&r, &3Oak&r, or &3Cherry&r trees to get &3Resin&r, then pipe the &3Resin&r into a &9Fractionating Still&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest74.title: Making Rosin
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest78.descrip: If you plan on taking on the Chaos Dragon it's strongly advised you do some work on Draconic Evolution.
To start you'll need to make a &9Fusion Crafter&r by crafting a &9Fusion Crafting Core&r, as well as &98 Draconium Fuision Crafting Injectors&r.
For now, we'll just be using &94 Injectors&r on each side, but you'll eventually want to have 5 on each side to be able to craft most things.
Place the &9Fusion Crafter Core&r in what will be the center of your setup.
Place the &94 injectors&r about 3 blocks away on the left and right side of the &9Fusion Crafting Core&r.
The injectors can be placed growing up in a cross pattern with an open space in the middle.
Supply the injectors with power (crystals or pipes should work), and you should be ready to go.
In this age, you can advance up to Draconic tier, here is each tier in order:
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest78.title: Fusion Crafting
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest84.descrip: You might have some gold from the Washing station.
If not you can make a Gold Seed, Gold Bee, or Gold Chicken.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest85.descrip: You'll need Silver Seeds, or a Silver Chicken to automate Silver.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest87.title: Green Paste
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest89.descrip: By now you should have a few options for &3Copper&r.
If you don't want more chickens, you can use &3Drowned Predictions&r, or you can get some Mystical Agriculture seeds.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest89.title: We Need More Copper
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest90.descrip: You will need Mystical Agriculture seeds, or get Evoker / Vindicator predictions in order to get &3Emeralds&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest90.title: Making Emeralds
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest91.descrip: You can put LPG or Biodiesel into the Thermopneumatic Processing Plant to get Molten Plastic.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest91.title: LPG or Biodiesel
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest92.title: Plastic Eye
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest93.title: Thermal Paste Eye
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.quest94.title: Infused Eye
ftbquests.chapter.tech_3.title: Tech
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest12.title: Thermal Evaporation
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest18.descrip: This is just a quick run down on roughly what to do with the machines below, to produce Hydrogen Chloride.
#1 Electrolytic Separator - Pumping water into this will produce Hydrogen and Oxygen
#1 Thermal Evaporation Plant - Sending water to the Thermal Evaporation Plant will create Brine.  Adding 4 Solar Generators to your Plant will significantly increase the production speed.
#2 Electrolytic Separator - Send Brine to a Electrolytic Separator and that will create Sodium and Chlorine
#3 Electrolytic Separator - Sending Water to another Separator will create Hydrogen and Oxygen
#4 Chemical Infuser - Send Chlorine from one of the Electrolytic Separators, and Hydrogen from the other.
This should net you some Hydrogen Chloride!
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest18.title: Hydrogen Chloride
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest20.descrip: Either send some excess Oxygen to the machine, or setup another Electrolytic Separator and use the Oxygen from that.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest20.title: Liquid Oxygen
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest24.descrip: Start by turning &3Uranium Ingots&r into &3Yellow Cake Uranium&r by putting the ingots in an &9Enrichment Chamber&r.
Move the &3Yellow Cake Uranium&r into a &9Chemical Oxidizer&r to get &3Uranium Oxide&r.
On one side of a &9Chemical Infuser&r pump in the &3Uranium Oxide&r.
On the other side, pump in &3Hydrofluoric Acid&r to create &3Uranium Hexafluoride&r.
You can make the &3Hydrofluoric Acid&r by adding &3Fluorite&r and &3Sulfuric Acid&r to a &3Chemical Dissolution Chamber&r.
Pump the &3Uranium Hexafluoride&r into a &9Isotopic Centrifuge&r to get &3Fissile Fuel&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest24.title: Making Fissile Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest30.descrip: You are free to make the Fission Reactor any size you see fit for your &3Pollonium&r production needs.
The examples provided will be using a 4 wide 5 tall setup, it's strongly advised to make a much bigger setup to produce Polonium faster.
You should definitely wait to turn everything on until the &9Fission Reactor&r is 100% full of coolant. Then you can start messing with the flow rate.
&c&oYou wouldnt want this to explode and destroy your base would you?&r&r
&oFor more advanced knowlege, check out this useful source: &bhttps://wiki.aidancbrady.com/wiki/Fission_Reactor_Tutorial&r&r
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest30.title: Making Fission
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest31.descrip: This example uses &367 Fission Reactor Casing&r, 8 Fission Fuel Assembly&3, &34 Control Rod Assembly&r, and &34 Fission Reactor Ports&r.
The &3Control Rod Assembly&r must sit on the top of each column of &3Fission Fuel Assemblies&r.
One port should be for your coolant input.
One port should be for your &3Fissile Fuel&r input.
One port should be for  your &3Nuclear Waste&r output. (&osee: Making &3Polonium&r&r)
One port should be for your &3Steam&r output. (&o&9Industrial Turbine&r&r)
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest31.title: Fission Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest32.descrip: Pump the &3Nuclear Waste&r from your &9Fission Reactor&r into a &9Solar Neutron Activator&r to get &3Polonium&r.
Pump &3Fluorite Dust&r, and &3Polonium&r into a &9Pressurized Reaction Chamber&r to get &3Polonium Pellets&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest32.title: Making Polonium
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest35.descrip: This example uses &3128 Turbine Casing&r, &333 Turbine Vent&r, &310 Turbine Blades&r, &38 Pressure Disperser&r, &36 Saturating Condensers&r, &33 Electromagnetic Coil&r, &35 Turbine Rotor&r, &31 Turbine Valve&r, and &31 Rotational Complex&r
The examples provided will be using a 5 wide 9 tall setup.

After building your basic frame with &3Turbine Casing&r, you will want to place down the &35 Turbine Rotors&r, followed by the &3Turbine Blades&r. On the top rotor, place down &31 Rotational Complex&r and surround it with &3Pressure Dispersers&r. For next layer you'll want to place &36 Saturating Condensers&r along with the &33 Electromagnetic Coils&r as shown in the second image.
Now you can fill in your frame with casing, or &3Structural Glass&r, and as for the top 3 layers - just surround all sides in &3Turbine Vents&r, including the top.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest35.title: Industrial Turbine
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest36.descrip: #1 Put &3Water&r in a &9Electrolytic Separator&r to create &3Hydrogen&r and &3Oxygen&r.
#2 Send &3Water&r, &3Hydrogen&r, and the &3Bio Fuel&r into a &9Pressurized Reaction Chamber&r which will create &3Substrate&r and &3Ethylene&r.
#3 Send &3Ethylene&r, &3Oxygen&r, and &3Substrate&r to another &9Pressurized Reaction Chamber&r and this should create the &3HDPE Pellet&r.
#4 Now you'll need to use another &9Enrichment Chamber&r to turn the pellets into sheets.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest36.title: Making HDPE
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest40.descrip: While not absolutely necessary to complete the pack, it's a cool setup to make, and it allows you to multiple various ores.
Click on the buckets to see the corresponding steps.
You will need to make the &9Thermal Evaporation Plants&r for the &9Fission Reactor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest40.title: Multiplying Ore
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest41.descrip: You'll need a lot of &3Chaos Shards&r for future crafting.
- Use the &3Awakened Spawn Egg&r to make a &3Chaos Spawn Egg&r in a &9Chaotic Tier injector&r
If you don't want to keep hunting down the Chaos Dragon you can make some Chaos Bees, so you'll want to save your first set of &3Chaos Shards&r.
To get a Chaos Bee Spawn Egg you will need to do the following:
- Squish &3Draconic Bees&r with a &3Piston&r into a &9Bottler&r, just like the Blizz in Age 3.
- Put the Draconic gene sample in a &9Centrifuge&r, repeat until you have about 5 genes.
- Use the 100% gene sampled &3Honey Treat&r, and an &3Egg&r in the &9BaBee Incubator&r to get the &3Draconic Bee Spawn Egg&r
- Use the &3Draconic Spawn Egg&r to make a &3Draconium Spawn Egg&r in a &9Wyvern Tier injector&r or better
- Use the &3Draconium Spawn Egg&r to make an &3Awakened Spawn Egg&r in a &9Draconic Tier injector&r or better
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest41.title: Chaos Shard
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest43.descrip: Before turning the reactor on, you will need to charge it up to start creating the &bContainment Field&r.
Before clicking "&bActivate&r" you will want to make sure that the &9Flux Gate&r inputting power into your reactor is set to the value you hope won't cause a meltdown.
If you've had success in activating your reactor, let everything balance out before you start adjusting the &9Flux Gate's&r input/output.

You want to try and keep your &bContainment Field Strength&r at around 50% while not letting the &bCore Temp&r reach &c8000c&r. By adjusting the input/outputs, it will re-balance using more shield, and providing more heat, which should in turn help you generate more power.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest44.descrip: The &3Reactor Stabilizers&r should be on the 4th block out from the center of the &9Draconic Reactor Core&r on all 4 sides:
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest45.descrip: From the bottom, the order should be:
1) Power source (&o&9Powah Reactors&r or &9Fission Reactors&r work great&r)
on the 4th block above the &9Reactor Energy Injector&r place the &9Reactor Energy Core&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest46.descrip: &b&nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RSQ-GDJgAKk&r&r by &6Lashmak&r might help you understand the &9Draconic Reactor&r a bit better.
&c&oThis reactor has the power to cause massive destruction if it overheats. It's heavily advised to build this a few hundred blocks away from your main base.&r&r
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest46.title: Draconic Power
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest47.descrip: In order to get your first &3Chaos Shard&r you will need to defeat the Chaos Dragon (see The End quests).
The Chaos Dragon is extremely difficult.
You should come prepared with Draconic Evolution Chest armor, and/or a fully upgraded Mek Suit.
You will need to have a Draconic Evolution weapon. It's also advised to have it fully equipped with Modules.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest47.title: Draconic Evolution
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest48.title: Put The Ore Here
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest49.descrip: To make sure you have enough room for the &9Tier 8 Energy Core&r:
You will want to place the &9Energy Core&r 7 blocks off the ground, with 7 blocks clearance above it.
If your stabilizers are in place, and after you place the core you can interact with it.
&aAs long as you have the blocks on your person, you can click "Assemble Core" and it will automatically create the structure for you.&r
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest50.descrip: To make sure you have enough room for the &9Tier 8 Energy Core&r:
You will want to place your Stabilizers on the 9th block out from the center of the core on all 4 sides.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest57.title: Organic CompOOst
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest58.descrip: You'll want to look at Mystical Agriculture or Productive Bees for both &3Apatite&r and &3Niter&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest58.title: Making Apatite and Niter
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest59.descrip: The &3Straw&r can be obtained by &9Haunting&r &3Wheat,&r while the &3Rotten Flesh&r would come from your &9Mob Grinder&r, Mystical Agriculture, or Hostile Neural Networks.
&3Dirt&r and &3Bone Meal&r should already be covered.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest59.title: Making Organic Compost
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest62.descrip: Using another &3I/O Crystal&r and a &9Flux Gate&r we are able to input power from our &9Energy Core&r. By clicking on the &9Flux Gate&r you can adjust the flow rate of the power input.

Similarly another &3I/O Crystal&r and &9Flux Gate&r is used to output power as well. This can connect to the back of any of the &9Reactor Stabilizers&r. It's advised to store the power in your &9Energy Core&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest63.descrip: The only fuel the &9Draconic Reactor&r will accept is &3Awakened Draconium&r.
I suggest adding it in block form, but you can also add ingots, and nuggets.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest64.descrip: For Tier 1 you will only need &31 Energy Core&r, and &34 Stabilizers&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest64.title: Tier 1
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest65.descrip: You will need to add &31 Draconium Block&r to each side of the core for Tier 2.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest65.title: Tier 2
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest66.descrip: For Tier 3 you will need to form a 3x3 cube around the core with 20 additional blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest66.title: Tier 3
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest67.descrip: Now you will need an additional &328 Draconium Blocks&r, as well as &326 Redstone Blocks&r.
You will need to remove the &3Draconium Blocks&r from the core and form a cube of &3Redstone Blocks&r around the core.
Using the &354 Draconium Blocks&r cover each &3Redstone Block&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest67.title: Tier 4
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest68.descrip: Going forward the &9Energy Cores Stabilizers&r will need to be upgraded. You can make an &9Advanced Stabilizer&r by putting 9 of them together in a 3x1x3 pattern. This will change the appearance to a larger stabilizer. This means that you're going to need an additional &332 Energy Core Stabilizers&r.
You'll need to remove the &3Draconium Blocks&r surrounding the &3Redstone Blocks&r, and replace them with the additional &354 Redstone Blocks&r.
Now, using the &390 Draconium Blocks&r you will need to surround the &3Redstone Blocks&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest68.title: Tier 5
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest69.descrip: Take off the layer of &3Draconium Block&r, replace it with the &398 Redstone Block&r, then surround the &3Redstone Block&r with the 150 Draconium Block.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest69.title: Tier 6
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest70.descrip: Strip the &3Draconium Blocks&r off, replace with the &3150 Redstone Blocks&r, then just surround the &3Redstone Blocks&r with the &3210 Draconium Blocks&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest70.title: Tier 7
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest71.descrip: Now you're going to have to remove all of the &3Draconium&r and &3Redstone Blocks&r to expose the &3Energy Core&r. You will be using the same pattern as the previous Tiers; except now you will be doing that with the &3786 Draconium Blocks.&r Once all the &3Draconium Blocks&r are placed, surround them with the &38 Awakened Draconium Blocks&r.
That's it! You now have an infinite (pretty much) mana battery!
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest71.title: Tier 8
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest72.descrip: Place &3Glass&r on top of an &9Energy Pylon&r which will allow you to input / output from your core.
If you're using Draconic Evolution Crystals to move power, make sure to set your I/O Mode to "Output from Block."
Output (&oTaking power out of the &9Energy Core&r&r):
If you're using &3Draconic Evolution Crystals&r to move power, make sure to set your I/O Mode to "Input from Block."
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest73.descrip: Now you have Polonium, and a massive quantity of power. You're ready to start making Anti-Matter!
Just pump energy and Polonium into the Super Critical Phase Shifter to produce Anti-Matter Pellets.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest73.title: Making Antimatter
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest8.subtitle: This is where your Ore or Raw metal journey begins.
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest9.descript: This is just a quick run down on roughly what to do with the machines below, to produce Sulfuric Acid.
#1 Electrolytic Separator - Pumping water into this will produce Hydrogen and Oxygen
#2 Rotary Condensentrator - Pumping water into this will produce Water Vapor
#3 Chemical Oxidizer - Placing Sulfur Dust into this machine will result in Sulfur Dioxide
#4 Chemical Infuser - On one side, pump the Oxygen from a Electrolytic Separator, on the other side pump in the Sulfur Dioxide from your Chemical Oxidizer to produce Sulfur Trioxide.
#5 Chemical Infuser - On one side, pump the Water Vapor from a Rotary Condensentrator, on the other side pump in the Sulfur Trioxide from the last Chemical Infuser.
This should net you some Sulfuric Acid!
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.quest9.title: Sulfuric Acid
ftbquests.chapter.tech_4.title: Tech
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest1.descrip: You might have hit a tree, maybe you hurt yourself, who knows.
&6Natural Progression&r changes up the early game slightly, so heres what you need to know:

In order to make your first tool, the &3Flint Axe&r -- you'll need to find &3Sticks&r and &3Pebbles&r on the ground. Place some &3Pebbles&r on your hotbar, and some in your offhand and start smashing them together. This should get you some &3Flint&r!
With &3Flint&r you can make a &3Flint Axe&r.
With a &3Flint Axe&r you can start chopping down trees, and killing mobs to get &3Bone&r, which you'll need to smash together with &3Flint&r to get &3Bone Shard&r.
To chop down a tree you should &aright click the tree to first strip it&r, then chop it.
To make &31 Plank&r you will need to craft the &3Hatchet&r together with the &3Stripped Log&r. When you get your first &3Saw&r, you will be able to turn &31 Stripped Log&r into &34 Planks&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest1.title: Sticks, Stones, and Bones
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest32.descri: You will need to craft a full set of &3Copper Armor&r, as well as a &3Copper Axe&r, &3Pickaxe&r, &3Shovel&r, and &3Hoe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest32.title: Unlocking Silver Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest33.descri: You will need to craft a full set of &3Silver Armor&r, as well as a &3Silver Axe&r, &3Pickaxe&r, &3Shovel&r, and &3Hoe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest33.title: Unlocking Iron Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest34.descri: Craft a &3Bone Pickaxe&r, and &3Bone Knife&r to start crafting &3Copper&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest34.title: Unlocking Copper Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest35.descri: You will need to craft a full set of &3Iron Armor&r, as well as a &3Iron Axe&r, &3Pickaxe&r, &3Shovel&r, and &3Hoe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest35.title: Unlock All Other Equipment
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest36.descri: Make sure to consume your &3Miner's Certificate&r. This will unlock the ability to use &6Ultiminer&r by holding down the &a`&r button.
&cWARNING&r: While &6Ultiminer&r is a great way to mine a lot of blocks at once, it consumes a significant amount of food when you use it.

If you want to mine a lot of blocks you can get a &3Feeding Upgrade&r for your &3Backpack&r and throw a lot of food in there. &cJust be careful about adding anything with Sugars, so it doesn't go above 70%&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest36.title: Unlock Ultiminer
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest37.descri: &6Natural Progression&r mod currently has a bug where all &3Sticks&r and &3Pebbles&r are spawning underwater.
You can accept free &3Sticks&r and &3Pebbles&r from this &arepeatable quest&r.
You can also find your own under water, but this is not the intended way for the mod.
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest37.subtit: This temporary quest is to resolve an issue with the mod Natural Progression
ftbquests.chapter.tools_1.quest37.title: Free Real Estate
